requirement: Implement hardware, software, and/or procedural mechanisms that record and examine activity in information systems containing or using ePHI (comprehensive audit logging).
productImplication: All user and system access to clinical documents, AI-generated recommendations, and query/appeal artifacts must produce immutable, queryable audit events (write-once storage + tamper detection).

requirement: Implement technical policies and procedures for electronic information systems that maintain ePHI to allow access only to those persons or software programs that have been granted access rights (unique user identification, emergency access, automatic logoff, encryption/decryption).
productImplication: Enforce RBAC at API and data layers; require unique Entra ID principal per human & service; implement session inactivity auto-logoff and AES-256/TLS1.3 encryption defaults.

requirement: Implement policies and procedures to protect ePHI from improper alteration or destruction (integrity mechanisms).
productImplication: Use cryptographic hashing (SHA-256) and versioned object storage for source documents and AI rationale; integrity checks validated at retrieval & before appeal submission.

requirement: Implement technical security measures to guard against unauthorized access to ePHI transmitted over an electronic communications network (integrity controls, encryption).
productImplication: Force TLS 1.3 for all external FHIR & payer API calls; mutual TLS or signed JWT client auth where supported; reject downgrade attempts.

requirement: CDI queries must be non-leading, clinically supported, and maintain retrievable audit trail including original content and physician response for defensibility.
productImplication: Query composer enforces template lint (no leading language); store pre/post states & rationale; expose audit filter for compliance review.

requirement: Case Mix Index = Sum of DRG relative weights / number of discharges; accurate CC/MCC capture directly influences reimbursement.
productImplication: Prioritization engine must weight documentation gaps by projected DRG weight uplift (CC/MCC specificity) to surface high CMI impact cases.
sources: CMS Case Mix Index Definition Page
